page.topic: How to Suppress Blank Lines in Layout Table Reports
page.description: Learn how blank lines in static HTML elements and empty rows in a Layout Table report can be omitted when the report is generated.

section.title: Suppressing Blank Lines in Static HTML

description.p: Placing fields in a static HTML filed is a technique often used to display blocks of text, such as an address, in Layout Table reports. If a field is empty, however, this can create blank lines in the static HTML block. The blank lines can be removed by using the Suppress Blank Lines command directives. For example:

description.p: Individual rows in a Layout Table report can be suppressed if they are blank. The *[ui:Suppress Blank]* property, when enabled, will omit blank rows from the report if the data in the report row is empty.
